options: Eliminating the need for clinical practice

questions.question: How does Virtual Reality (VR) primarily benefit nursing students?
options: By allowing practice in a fully immersive
By providing overlays digital information onto real-world settings

questions.question: What is the core principle of Competency-Based Education (CBE) in nursing?
options: Progress is based on time spent in the program.
Progress is based on demonstrating mastery of skills.
It focuses solely on theoretical knowledge.

questions.question: Which future role of a nurse educator involves using analytics to track student progress?

options: It consists of short, focused modules.
It is only used for advanced specialization topics.

questions.question: In a flipped classroom model, how is class time primarily used?
options: For independent study of new theory

questions.question: Which challenge refers to the potential inequality in access to educational technology?
What is a suggested solution to address the ethical concern of AI bias in educational algorithms?
options: Use transparent and inclusive data sets.
Limit AI use to administrative tasks.

questions.question: What is one recommendation for educators preparing for the future?
options: Avoid collaborating internationally to maintain curriculum control.
Pilot innovations with small groups before full implementation.
Limit student access to digital tools to prevent over-reliance.

questions.question: According to the vision, the future of nursing education should be:
options: Human-centered, globally connected, and ethically grounded
Focused only on local healthcare practices

questions.question: What is the simplified definition of Green Nursing?
options: Using only digital records to save paper.
Focusing exclusively on patient health outcomes.
A nursing specialty for outdoor emergency care.

questions.question: Why is Green Nursing considered important?
options: It increases the use of single-use plastics for hygiene.
It helps reduce pollution and save resources.
It makes nursing care more expensive.
It simplifies nursing duties by eliminating waste sorting.

questions.question: Which action is an example of a nurse's role in Green Nursing?
options: Always using new, disposable equipment for every patient.
Leaving lights and equipment on for convenience.
Using reusable items when possible and recycling properly.

questions.question: What does Augmented Reality (AR) do in a clinical training context?
options: Replaces the need for real-world settings entirely.
Overlays digital information onto real-world settings.
Allowing practice in a fully immersive settings.
Creates a completely fictional environment for students.

Adopting and integrating new technologies into teaching.
Engaging in international partnerships and virtual exchanges.
Ensuring that tech-enhanced learning remains humane and inclusive.

questions.question: Which strategy combines online and face-to-face learning for flexibility?
What is a student example given to illustrate Green Nursing?
options: Using more single-use syringes for safety.
Using reusable plastic trays instead of single-use ones.
Recommending longer hot showers for patients.

questions.question: Which challenge involves the risk of student data being exposed or misused?
What is the recommended way for educators to "Empower Students" for the future?
options: By limiting their access to information.
